intro: Diaphoranthema uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are borne singly at the tips of the stems, making it a distinctive and ornamental species. Diaphoranthema uniflora prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers.
